programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: New York, NY and Provincetown, MA: Experience the formative moments of Tony's career as he revisits his first job, the culinary institute that taught him the basics, a normal workday at Les Halles Brasserie, and his mysterious mentor, Bigfoot.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Napa, CA: Marooned in San Francisco, Tony tastes local shellfish and durian ice cream before embarking on a pilgrimage to experience the genius of Thomas Keller, chef and owner of The French Laundry.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: What is a Carioca? The natives of Rio de Janiero, Brazil are lovable scamps who find ways to avoid work, preferring the beach, flirting, and hanging out at restaurants and bars instead. Tony, under the tutelage of an exemplary Carioca, gives the lifestyle a try.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: Eating on the Edge of Nowhere
programme.desc: Cambodia and Japan: Taking his obsession with the film Apocalypse Now a little too seriously, Tony sets out for Pailin, reputed to be one of the most dangerous towns on earth. After his journey, Tony returns to Japan.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: No Beads, No Babes, No Bourbon Street
programme.desc: In New Orleans, Louisiana, Tony catches a Bayou alligator, cools off with a world-famous snow cone, gets in trouble with the law, eats jambalaya with a dancing chef, and relaxes to some local jazz.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Rural Japan: Tony decides to look for a more relaxing, traditional Japanese culinary experience in the countryside. Tony travels to an old-style Japanese inn that specializes in kaiseki cuisine, ancient tea ceremony, and local ingredients.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: To Rick, shopping when you are hungry can facilitate inspiration, and in the Merida market he becomes inspired to make homemade tamales made from fresh corn masa flavored with achiote-seasoned chicken or pork and steamed in banana leaves.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Carnitas are a weekend family tradition in Mexico. At the Medellin Market in Mexico City, Rick gives us an insider's look at how carnitas are made in a huge copper cauldron and served up with fresh corn tortillas and crispy chicharron.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: What could be better than a freshly made quesadilla? In Mexico, Rick takes us to the Bazar Sabado to experience the true art of the quesadilla, and where the delicate treats are made the traditional way. Rick also prepares fresh cheese.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: By now the secret is out: Rick has a sweet tooth. When Rick travels to Mexico, he is on the prowl for it all, from ripe fruit to homemade candies to luscious pies. Rick will also share his personal Caramelized Papaya with Mexican Cheese.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: At one time, the henequen trade made Merida, the capital of the Yucatan, one of the richest cities in the world. Journey with Rick into the Merida market stalls for a fresh look at the blending of Mayan traditions with Spanish influences.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: To celebrate a friend's birthday, Rick reinvents the ice cream social where everyone brings a batch of homemade ice cream. Inspired by the infinitely varied frozen treats and sweets of Mexico, Rick prepares three fresh takes of his own.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.sub-title: Myanmar: The Cult of the Nats
programme.desc: Each year in Tangbyon an important ritual takes place where thousands of Burmans ask their mediums to dance so they may contact the Nats, spirits that can offer them a better future. Since homosexuality is illegal here, the ritual provides a space where L.G.B.T.Q. people can exist without hiding.

programme.title: The New Environmentalists
programme.desc: Biodiversity is a central component to the successful operation of Earth's natural systems. Meet people from Haiti, Myanmar, Honduras, Kenya, Canada, and Scotland who spend time and energy securing healthy local environmental regulations.

programme.title: The New Environmentalists
programme.desc: There are places on Earth worthy of absolute preservation and protection for all future generations. Meet people from Puerto Rico, Maryland, Peru, Tanzania, Slovakia, and Cambodia who all share an abiding belief in a sacred, healthy Earth.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.desc: Meet the people of America's national parks who help preserve our monuments and conserve our park's beauty. They rappel down the towering granite faces of Mount Rushmore, they execute prescribed burns in the Grand Canyon, and they plow the treacherous Going-to-the-Sun Road in Glacier National Park.

programme.title: Inside America's National Parks
programme.desc: Experience the supreme and sacred spectacle of the Grand Canyon. This insider's view of one of the world's greatest natural wonders takes you rim-to-rim to hike hidden canyons, plunge into ancient pools, raft world-class rapids, discover manmade gems, and explore extreme backcountry.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.desc: If you like your nature a little weird, then this is the show for you. See all the freaks of nature in the best parks ever.

programme.title: The Healthy Voyager
programme.desc: Carolyn Scott-Hamilton showcases the best of the Yucatan including prime locations to stay, exceptional sites to visit, and unique restaurants specializing in plant-based vegan food that will satisfy the healthy traveler in you.

programme.title: Savour Australia
programme.desc: In Western Australia, Jason visits vineyards, goes on a food adventure for crayfishes, truffles, and finger limes, and visits a Brazilian food in Perth city.

programme.title: Me, Myself, and the World
programme.desc: Pamela continues her visit to the beautiful island of Bali, Indonesia, inspiring others to join her Solo Travel Revolution. She explores Seminyak, takes a Muay Thai class, and offers travel tips on her segment "Packing with Pamela."

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: From England to Turkey, we explore the greatest Roman cities, marveling at their over-the-top art, soaring aqueducts, and crowd-pleasing theaters. As Rome fell, saints replaced Caesars and Christianity filled the vacuum with art-filled churches.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.sub-title: Art of the Early Middle Ages
programme.desc: Europe’s Christians kept culture alive with art rooted in their faith. Romanesque churches filled with art that reinforced the ruling order, whereas Byzantines had their dazzling mosaics and Spanish Muslims had lush palaces.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.sub-title: Art of the High Middle Ages
programme.desc: Europe’s growing prosperity was reflected in soaring Gothic cathedrals with colorful altarpieces, lacy stonework, and radiant stained glass. In Italy, pioneering artists like Giotto were mastering realism and pointing the way to the future of art.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: After its medieval struggles, Europe rediscovered the art of the ancients. We revel in the bold spirit of the Cathedral’s lofty dome and the great artists such as Botticelli, da Vinci and Michelangelo, taking the Renaissance to new heights.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: In Milan, we'll peek at Italy's noteworthy fashion, delis and opera house.

programme.title: WaterVoyagers - Chinese Adventures
programme.desc: The food in China is fabulous with something for everyone.

programme.title: Discovering the World
programme.desc: Jerusalem is a holy city for Jews, Christians, and Muslims, and each has its holy stone here: The Wailing Wall, the Stone of the Holy Sepulchre, and the Rock beneath the famous gold cupola. The Old City concentrates an extraordinary amount of historical, religious, and cultural treasures.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: In the heart of the Amazon rainforest of Brazil, the Satere-Mawe people have a rite of passage leading to adulthood where a feat of bravery turns boys into men. According to tribe members, this painful initiation prepares young men for life and proves they can fulfill their reproductive obligations.

programme.title: Secrets of the National Parks
programme.desc: Get "a touch of the tundra" as you take in Denali's stunning scenery through the dome-roofed cars of the Denali Star train, meet sled dogs at the Kennels, and take a discovery hike to experience the untamed wilderness and diverse wildlife much as the first explorers to the region once did.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.sub-title: National Parks of the Great Southwest
programme.desc: From Canyonlands and Arches to Saguaro and Death Valley, the wonders of the American Southwest spread across extreme lands of astonishing beauty. Climb the face of a monolith millions of years in the making, seek out a sunrise horseback ride through cactus country, and much more.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: Best Parks You've Never Heard of
programme.desc: See where astronauts trained for moon missions and dive miles deep into crystal caves in the best parks that you've never heard of.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: Mickela examines Portugal's colonial influence on the indigenous tribal communities of Eastern Malaysia as she joins in on the annual celebration of Gawai Dayak, the Harvest Festival.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: The Bronx is not only known as the Borough of Salsa, it is also known as the Borough of Music. Follow Mickela as she delves into the longstanding Puerto Rican musical style whose influence stretches across New York City.

programme.title: Moments in Time with Elia Locardi
programme.desc: It is tulip photo mania in the Netherlands! Elia joins local photographer Albert Dros to photograph one of the largest tulip fields in the world. Later, two of Elia's friends compete in a photography challenge, using Elia as their model.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: Diane reveals the ancient grains that Greek cooks love to use. Learn how to make the classic Cretan Barley Rusk (twice baked bread) called Paximadi, as well as a savory pasta dish. Also, observe how trahana can transform a dish.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: Nemea and Argos have their own character and cuisine, and both are home to some of Greece's most famous wines and tempting dishes. Whether in the town square with a village cook, or with Diane in her kitchen, amazing local dishes await.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: Learn to make bacon from scratch, plus a twist on Canadian bacon.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: Pitmasters fire up grills, smokers, and wood ovens all day.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: Vietnamese and Thai influences create ultimate street food.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: Reinventing the cocktail party with live fire.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: Get an inside look at the tools and fuels for creative smoked ribs!

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: Rotisserie grilling combines smoky sear with roasting heat.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.sub-title: Art of the Renaissance Beyond Florence
programme.desc: From Italy, the Renaissance spread across Europe, revolutionizing art. In Spain and Portugal, overseas plunder is transformed into lacy architecture. In bustling Germany and Belgium, new technologies enable mass-produced engravings and oil paintings.
